alert.note: Alert for Caledonia (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 1:44PM EDT until July 07 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Caledonia County in northeastern Vermont... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 144 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks, streams, highways, secondary roads, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... St. Johnsbury, Lyndon, Danville, Walden, Barnet, Stannard, Peacham, Wheelock, North Danville, Greenbank Hollow, West Danville and East Peacham. Torrential rainfall is ongoing in the headwaters of the Passumpsic River Basin, particularly in the Danville and North Danville areas and Sleepers River watershed. These small tributaries will rise rapidly in the next few hours, leading to a higher threat of flash flooding. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
